thread.title: Gibson’s versatility aiding Eagle’s Landing effort
thread.title_full: Gibson’s versatility aiding Eagle’s Landing effort

author: Neighbor Newspapers (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Gibson’s versatility aiding Eagle’s Landing effort
text: slideshow When asked what senior running back Antonio Gibson brings to his Eagle’s Landing football team, head coach Shawn Jones smiled.“Antonio is an explosive player and explosive players typically give you explosive results and Antonio is just that type player, explosive,” he said.However, Eagle’s Landing opponents have seen thus far this season that the 17-year-old son of Annette Williams is not only explosive, but can hurt an opponent in so many ways, whether it be rushing, passing or receiving.“He is a triple threat for us as he can throw the ball, run with the ball or receive the ball and run with it with equal effectiveness,” Jones said.“It is because of his versatility that we try to put him in a position in which he can use his explosive talent to help us.”Through six games this year, Gibson has lived up to his coach’s expectations, thanks in great part to his 4.5-second speed in the 40.In that time span, he has 72 carries for 571 yards, almost an eight-yards-per-carry average and has scored six touchdowns.As a receiver, he has had 27 receptions for 339 yards, a 12.6 yards-per-carry average, with two touchdowns.Although he has been on the varsity squad since his freshman year, this is the first year Jones has used him more as a rusher than a pass receiver.“It’s a little different than what I had been accustomed to as a receiver but I am enjoying it as I get the ball more now as a rusher, as I carry the ball about 20 times each game,” he said.One opposing coach, who asked to remain anonymous, called Gibson one of the best ball carriers in the state.“It’s great to get a compliment like that from an opposing coach,” Gibson said.“Getting a compliment like that from any coach makes me work hard me work harder as I try to improve each game.”Although he has already received a college football scholarship offer from Tennessee State, Jones believes that is only the beginning.“This is one of many offers I anticipate Antonio receiving as he has college football programs from different divisions looking at him,” the coach said.“The better he plays, the more offers he will receive,” Jones said.From an academic perspective, Gibson enjoys learning, regardless of the subject.However he is most interested in world history, especially how a country’s economy impacts its development.
